Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for DNS zones, record types, and integration with existing on-premises or cloud-based networks.
Design the DNS architecture, including the structure of DNS zones, record types, and failover mechanisms.
Set up DNS zones in Azure DNS to host domain names. Ensure proper naming conventions and configurations.
Add DNS records such as A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, TXT, and SRV records to the DNS zones based on application requirements.
Enable DNS security features such as DNSSEC (if supported) and restrict access to DNS zones using Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC).
Integrate Azure DNS with existing on-premises or cloud-based networks. Configure conditional forwarding or private DNS zones if required.
Perform thorough testing of DNS resolution for all configured records. Validate failover scenarios and ensure proper propagation.
Set up monitoring and alerting for DNS zone health and record changes using Azure Monitor and Azure Activity Logs.
Document the DNS architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Ensure the DNS setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
